perturbation.original_text:
6.5
Trade Names. The Company shall not create or use any corporate or trade names that include the Arizona Licensed Trademarks, other than those
in existence immediately prior to the Effective Date. No later than thirty (30) days following the Closing, each of AWP and the Company shall
change its respective corporate name and trade name and cause its organizational documents to be amended to remove any reference to
“Armstrong.”
perturbation.changed_text:
6.5
Trade Names. The Company shall not create or use any corporate or trade names that include the Arizona Licensed Trademarks, other than those
in existence immediately prior to the Effective Date. Notwithstanding the previous sentence, the Company has up to one hundred and twenty (120) days following the Closing, each of AWP and the Company shall
change its respective corporate name and trade name and cause its organizational documents to be amended to remove any reference to
“Armstrong.”
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by initially stating a prohibition on creating trade names with licensed trademarks, then delaying the deadline to remove existing references to 'Armstrong' from 30 days to 120 days. This contradiction could lead to disputes about the acceptable timeframe for rebranding.

perturbation.original_text:
12.1
Term and Termination.
(a)
Unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provisions hereof, the term of this Agreement and the licenses and other grants of rights (and
related obligations) under this Agreement shall (i) with respect to the Arizona Licensed Trademarks, be for the Arizona Trademark License
Term, (ii) with respect to the Diamond Licensed Trademarks, be for the Diamond Trademark License Term, (iii) with respect to the Phase-
Out Marks, be for the term set forth in Section 6.6, and (iv) with respect to Copyrights, Know-How and Patents, be in perpetuity.
(b)
Either Party may terminate this Agreement if the other Party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to remedy such breach within
thirty (30) days’ written notice thereof; provided, however, that if the material breach of this Agreement by the breaching Party is limited to
the Licensed Copyrights, Licensed Know-How, the Arizona Licensed Patents, or the Licensed Trademarks, the non-breaching Party shall
be entitled to termination solely with respect to the affected part of the license (i.e., in such case, the non-breaching Party may terminate
this Agreement with respect to the Licensed Copyrights or the Licensed Know-How or the Arizona Licensed Patents or the Licensed
Trademarks, as applicable).
perturbation.changed_text:
12.1
Term and Termination.
(a)
Unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provisions hereof, the term of this Agreement and the licenses and other grants of rights (and
related obligations) under this Agreement shall (i) with respect to the Arizona Licensed Trademarks, be for the Arizona Trademark License
Term, (ii) with respect to the Diamond Licensed Trademarks, be for the Diamond Trademark License Term, (iii) with respect to the Phase-
Out Marks, be for the term set forth in Section 6.6, and (iv) with respect to Copyrights, Know-How and Patents, be in perpetuity.
(b)
Either Party may terminate this Agreement if the other Party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to remedy such breach within
sixty (60) days’ written notice thereof; provided, however, that if the material breach of this Agreement by the breaching Party is limited to
the Licensed Copyrights, Licensed Know-How, the Arizona Licensed Patents, or the Licensed Trademarks, the non-breaching Party shall
be entitled to termination solely with respect to the affected part of the license (i.e., in such case, the non-breaching Party may terminate
this Agreement with respect to the Licensed Copyrights or the Licensed Know-How or the Arizona Licensed Patents or the Licensed
Trademarks, as applicable). However, no termination can occur if the breach pertains to Diamond Licensed Trademarks; in this event, the agreement will automatically renew for another Diamond Trademark License Term.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a conflict in the termination clause. Initially, a 60-day cure period for any material breach is given. The added sentence regarding the Diamond Licensed Trademarks creates an inconsistency: the breaching party now avoids termination, but the clause provides no remedy for the non-breaching party. This creates uncertainty in enforcement and could lead to disputes.

return receipt requested), or (iii) on the next Business Day after being sent by reputable overnight courier (delivery prepaid), in each case, to the

13.3
Notices. All notices and other communications given or made pursuant hereto shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given (i)
on the date delivered, if delivered personally, (ii) on the third (3rd) Business Day after being mailed by registered or certified mail (postage prepaid,
return receipt requested), or (iii) on the next Business Day after being sent by reputable overnight courier (delivery prepaid), in each case, to the

Notwithstanding anything in this section 13.3 to the contrary, any notice regarding a breach of this agreement shall only be effective if sent via registered mail.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces a contradiction in the notice clause. While the initial part allows for various methods of notice (personal delivery, mail, courier, email), the added sentence restricts notices regarding breach to registered mail only. This creates ambiguity as to which method is acceptable for breach notices, leading to potential disputes over proper notification and enforcement.
